item.title: Introduction
Basic Types
item.description: Strings str := "Hello" Multiline string str := `Multiline string` Numbers Typical types num := 3 // int num := 3. // float64 num := 3 + 4i // complex128 num := byte('a') // byte (alias for uint8) Other Types var u uint = 7 // uint (unsigned) var p float32 = 22.7 // 32-bit float Arrays // var numbers [5]int numbers := [...]int{0, 0, 0, 0, 0} Pointers func main () { b := *getPointer() fmt.

item.title: Flow Control
item.description: Condition if day == "sunday" || day == "saturday" { rest() } else if day == "monday" && isTired() { groan() } else { work() } if _, err := doThing(); err != nil { fmt.Println("Uh oh") Switch switch day { case "sunday": // cases don't "fall through" by default! fallthrough case "saturday": rest() default: work() } Loop for count := 0; count <= 10; count++ { fmt.Println("My counter is at", count) } entry := []string{"Jack","John","Jones"} for i, val := range entry { fmt.

item.title: Miscellaneous
item.description: Miscellaneous Options Miscellaneous Options for i in {1..255}; do (ping -c 1 192.168.1.${i} | grep "bytes from" &); done - Scan for hosts in subnet nc -w 1 192.168.110.52 1-10000 -v -z -n 2>&1 | grep succeeded - Scan host range of ports using nc for i in {1..65535}; do (echo > /dev/tcp/192.168.1.1/$i) >/dev/null 2>&1 && echo $i is open; done - Scan host range of ports gobuster dir -u https://10.

item.title: Nmap
item.description: Nmap Options Nmap Options 10.10.10.0/24 - Target network range. -sn - Disables port scanning. -Pn - Disables ICMP Echo Requests -n - Disables DNS Resolution. -PE - Performs the ping scan by using ICMP Echo Requests against the target. --packet-trace - Shows all packets sent and received. --reason - Displays the reason for a specific result. --disable-arp-ping - Disables ARP Ping Requests. --top-ports=<num> - Scans the specified top ports that have been defined as most frequent.
